intro: Solanum nigrum var. miniatum, commonly known as the dwarf black nightshade, is a compact variant of the black nightshade plant. It is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and usually white or pale green, blooming in summer. The berries are toxic when unripe but can be used in culinary applications when fully mature.
